docs.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA, June 19 (AP) -- After struggling in two straight starts, Red Sox pitcher Curt Schilling was sent back to Boston to receive a magnetic resonance imaging exam on his pitching shoulder. Schilling, a 40-year old right-hander, nearly pitched a no-hitter at Oakland on June 7, giving up a two-out single to Shannon Stewart in the ninth inning.
docs.abstract: Boston Red Sox pitcher Curt Schilling will have MRI on shoulder (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: The saga of Manny Ramirez always seems to end the same way. No matter what happens, Ramirez shows up for work -- eventually -- and hits better than almost anyone alive. The Boston Red Sox believe this can still happen, even after spending the winter trying to accommodate his trade request. A deal never materialized, and the team gave Ramirez an extra week to report to spring training. When he finally made it on Wednesday, Ramirez pledged to do what he always does.
docs.abstract: Boston Red Sox outfielder Manny Ramirez promises to play his hardest, despite offseason spent trying for trade; photo (M)
docs.snippet: No matter what happens, Manny Ramirez shows up for work  eventually  and hits better than almost anyone alive....

headline.main: Ramirez Turns Bumpy Trail Into a Happy Trail
